intro: Weinmannia madagascariensis var. aniba, commonly known as the Madagascan Weinmannia, is a shrub or small tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically followed by spherical, woody fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments within forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
